projectDesc.p: This text was created by the Lewis H. Beck Center as a part of the Oxford Experience Project. Project participants intend for this encoded text, as well as all texts produced by this project, to be made available on the web for educational, scholarly and pedagogical purposes.

samplingDecl.p: The archival material has been transcribed and encoded. Paratextual elements may be provided as digital images only, with some exceptions.

editorialDecl.p: Processing this electronic text file began by creating TIFF images of each page using either a flatbed scanner. Text pages were captured in color at 300dpi. These digital images were converted to an electronic text file by transcription. The text files produced have been proofread against the original document or a JPEG image of the original. This proofread text file has then been encoded using the recommendations for Level 3 of the TEI in Libraries Guidelines. For the details of Level 3 encoding, please see the webpage for TEI Guidelines for Best Encoding practices at http://www.indiana.edu/~letrs/tei/. Encoders silently replaced em dashes with two dashes. Page numbers and other text such as titles displayed in brackets have been added by the encoder and do not appear in the original text.

revisionDesc.change: On 2009-10-05 Ramalingam, Tejas , Mendez, Alejandra, Ahmed, Kalvin, Cody, Cornisha , and Holloman, Alesea transcribed and encoded the document.

div.head: Few Hall Minutes
Few Hall Hall June 24th '43
div.p: At the usual time the members convened- the vice President took the chair. A resolution was offered importing that the Badges should not be painted around the borders. It was overruled.

Resolved-A member offering a resolution, for changing the Badge be fined $5.00. Coluard. Attorney proceded to the discharge of his duty- Jones, E E Jones & Moore, H.B. W. B. Moore fined 12 1/2 cts for smoking - Edgeworth and P.D. Harper 12 1/2. tardiness - Jones, S.S. Jones 25 cts failing to speak (app) strong-ditto- Miscore ditto- Question chosen- Is slavery recognized by the laws of God & should it be tolerated by the laws of man?

The house proceeded to the election of officers which resulted as follows- Edgeworth, Egdeworth Pres. Richards, Richards V. Pres. Ellison, Ellison Secretary. Pitts, Pitts U. Sec. Ardis, Ardis, Treas. Miscon, Miscon Attorney- Ardis orator. The orator delivered his address. The debate called & commanded. & carried on very zealously. Decided in the negative
the motion adjourned. Question for the day- Is there any plausability in the doctrine of Predestination?
A. learning hamster, Coluard sec S. Ellison, Pres. pro. tem
